alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 14 at 3:49AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with local amounts up to 8 inches possible. Dangerous wind chills of 30 to 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...North Laramie Range, Platte and Goshen Counties, eastern Laramie County. This includes Wheatland, Glendo, Torrington, and Pine Bluffs. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory from 11 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Monday. Wind Chill Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and low visibilities in falling snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could may lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; North Laramie Range
